Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed save for broad reserved band near lip; decoration in added red and white, from top: white zig-zag; red band between white bands; exterior, cream slip: at lip, between bands, frieze of tongues with dots in interstices; below, zig-zag band dotted likewise; handle zone frieze almost wholly worn.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: From same vessel as 1888,0601.532a-e and g-h, and Oxford G119.39.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243. no. 6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 42, 48, pl. VIII, no. 1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.186)
